verses.verse: {The Prince of Peace} d {This v. is 8:23 in the MT} But there will be no gloom for her who was {So DSS; MT reads those who were} in distress. Formerly, he brought contempt to the region of Zebulun and the region of Naphtali, but in the future {So DSS; MT reads the latter time} he will have made glorious the way of the sea, the territory beyond the Jordan Galilee of the nations. {Or gentiles}
{This v. is 9:1 in the MT} The people who walked in darkness have seen a great light; for those living in a land of deep darkness, a light has shined upon them.

You have increased the nation; you have increased its joy; they rejoice in your presence as they rejoice at the harvest, as they are glad when they're dividing the spoils of war. {1QIsa a MT lack of war}

Now as to the yoke that has been {Lit. yoke of} his burden, and the bar laid {DSS The Heb. lacks laid} on his shoulder the rod of his oppressor you have broken it {1QIsa a MT lack it} as on the day of Midiam. {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads Midian ; cf. Judg 7:8-25 2King 15:19; 16:8}
For every boot of the tramping soldier in battle tumult and every garment rolled in blood will be used for burning as fuel for a fire.

For to us a child is born, to us a son is given; and the government will be upon his shoulder, and his name is {So 1QIsa a ; MT 4QIsa c read name will be} called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.

Of the growth of his government and peace there will be no end. He will rule {DSS MT lack He will rule} over his kingdom, sitting on the throne of David, to establish it and to uphold it {So 1QIsa a , referring to the throne; MT reads it , referring to the kingdom} with justice and righteousness from this time onward and forevermore. The zeal of the Lord of the Heavenly Armies will accomplish this.
{A Rebuke to Jacob and Israel} d "The Lord {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads Lord} has sent a plague {So LXX; MT reads word ; 1QIsa a can mean plague or word .} against Jacob, and it will fall on Israel;
and all of the people were evil {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read knew} Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria saying proudly with arrogant hearts:
Â«The bricks have fallen, but we will build with dressed stones; the sycamore trees have been cut down, but we will replace them with cedars.'
But the Lord has raised adversaries {So 1QIsa a MT LXX; other MT mss. read princes} from Rezin {So 1QIsa a MT; LXX lacks from Rezin} against him, and he stirs up his enemies

Arameans from the east and Philistines from the west and they devour Israel with open mouths! "Yet {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa c ; the Heb. lacks Yet} for all this, his anger has not turned away, and his hand is still stretched out, ready to strike." {DSS MT lack ready to strike}

{Judgment for Not Repenting} d "But the people have not returned to rely {1QIsa a MT LXX lack to rely} on {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads toward ; LXX reads until} him who struck them, nor have they sought the Lord of the Heavenly Armies.
So the Lord has cut off from Israel head and tail, palm branch and reed in {So 1QIsa a LXX; the The Heb. lacks in} a single day
the elder and the dignitary is the head, and the prophet who teaches lies is the tail.
For those who guide this people have been leading them astray, and those who are guided by them are swallowed up.

Therefore the Lord does not have pity on {So 1QIsa a ;MT LXX read rejoice over} their young men, and has no compassion on their orphans {Or fatherless} and widows, because each of them was godless and an evildoer, and every mouth spoke folly. "Yet {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa c ; the Heb. lacks Yet} for all this, his anger has not turned away, and his hand is still stretched out, ready to strike. {DSS MT lack ready to strike}
"For wickedness has burned like a blaze that consumes briers and thorns; it sets thickets of the forest on fire, and skyward {Lit. upward} they swirl in a column of smoke.
From {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads By} the wrath of the Lord of the Heavenly Armies the land has been scorched, and the people have become like fuel for the fire; no one will spare his neighbor.

They cut meat on the right, but they're still hungry, and they devour also {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lacks also} on the left, but they're not satisfied; each devours the flesh of his own children. {So 4QIsa e ; or arms ; 1QIsa a MT read offsprin g or arm ; LXX reads arm}

Manasseh devours Ephraim, and Ephraim devours Manasseh; together they are against Judah. "Yet {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack Yet} for all this, his anger has not turned away, and his hand is still stretched out, ready to strike." {DSS MT lack ready to strike}
